intro: Saguaster vitiensis, commonly known as the Vitiensis saguaster, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or lowland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some tropical gardens for its vibrant blooms.
